org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.amp

Class AmpReportsSchema

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.AbstractReportsSchema
      • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.amp.AmpReportsSchema
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NiReportsSchema
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestcasesReportsSchema

    public class AmpReportsSchema
extends AbstractReportsSchema
    the big, glorious, immaculate, AMP NiReports schema. This class is a big monolithic mess, mirrorring the way the AMP business domain is

      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> synchronizeAmpColumnsBackport(javax.servlet.ServletContext sCtx)
      This method is created for the following scenario a column was added to AmpReportsSchema this column doesn't exist in the old reports schema (described by AmpColumns) In this scenario, opening a report with said new column in the old reports engine would probably result in a crash.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> synchronizeAmpMeasureBackport()
      This method is created for the following scenario:
      - a measure was added to AmpReportsSchema
      - this measure doesn't exist in the old reports schema (described by AmpMeasures)
      In this scenario, opening a report with said new measure in the old reports engine would probably result in a crash.

        public static final java.util.List<java.lang.String> ONLY_MEASURELESS_HIERARCHIES
        Hierarchies that are allowed only for measureless reports. Since Indicators are not linked to funding we cannot use hierarchies by indicator since it would lead to double counting.

      • addDerivedMeasure

        protected <K> void addDerivedMeasure(java.lang.String measureName,
                                     java.lang.String baseMeasureName,
                                     java.util.function.Function<NiReportsEngine,K> contextBuilder,
                                     java.util.function.BiFunction<K,CategAmountCell,java.lang.Boolean> extraFilter,
                                     Behaviour<?> behaviour)
        adds a computed-filtering measure which is derived from an another measure by the means of supplementarily filtering by a given function
        Parameters:
        measureName - the measure you are creating
        baseMeasureName - the measure based on which you are creating
        contextBuilder - the per-fetch context to build (precalculated info for the supplemental filterer)
        extraFilter - the per-cell filterer
        behaviour - the behaviour of the column

      • migrateColumns

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> migrateColumns()
        AMP's painful history had the same entities being defined alternatively as measures/columns. Now that all of it is settled / decided by the place the entity is defined in AmpReportsSchema, we need a script to migrate "column X" to "measure X" iff:
        • column X does not exist in the schema
        • column X exists in the database
        • column X is used in existing reports
        • measure X exists in the schema

        Returns:

      • synchronizeAmpColumnsBackport

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> synchronizeAmpColumnsBackport(javax.servlet.ServletContext sCtx)
        This method is created for the following scenario
        • a column was added to AmpReportsSchema
        • this column doesn't exist in the old reports schema (described by AmpColumns)
        In this scenario, opening a report with said new column in the old reports engine would probably result in a crash. To avoid this, an entry referring to an empty view is added -- so that the column is shown having no data (since there's no point in backporting the column entirely).

      • synchronizeAmpMeasureBackport

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> synchronizeAmpMeasureBackport()
        This method is created for the following scenario:
        - a measure was added to AmpReportsSchema
        - this measure doesn't exist in the old reports schema (described by AmpMeasures)
        In this scenario, opening a report with said new measure in the old reports engine would probably result in a crash.
        Therefore, an empty row for said measure is added.

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Long> getWorkspaceActivities(NiReportsEngine engine)

        Parameters:
        engine -

        public static void init()
                 throws AMPException
        initializes the NiReports subsystem.
        Notice that this is not strictly necessary for being able to run NiReports, but it runs many self-checks as part of running a very simple report and cached some frequently-used data
